message: Today is the 115th Congress's #OpeningDay. It is an honor to continue to serve Ohio's 10th Congressional District. I look forward to great accomplishments for our country during this congress.
I am excited to work with the new administration as we move the economy forward and strengthen our national defense capabilities.  Click to read my statement on #OpeningDay of the 115th Congress.
I'm in Washington for the start of the 115th Congress.   Click to watch my interview with WHIO.
Yesterday I relayed my top priority to Mike Pence and it is a simple one: repeal sequestration.  Click to read my full statement.
There's a #BetterWay than Obamacare. I've reintroduced 3 bills to ensure everyone has access to quality, affordable healthcare.  Click to read my full statement.
I continue to strongly support Israel and I look forward to working with the new administration on strengthening this important relationship.
My thoughts are with the victims and families of the Fort Lauderdale attack.
Thank you to our law enforcement for the work they do to protect our communities every day. #BackTheBlue

I would like to congratulate both parties on reaching a tentative agreement. RTAâ€™s continued service to our communityâ€™s students, elderly and every day riders remains unmatched. I appreciate the continued dedication and hard work of the Dayton RTA employees. I hope to see this agreement approved and enacted as soon as possible.
Today, I spoke on the House floor in support of General James Mattis as the next Secretary of Defense. Click here to watch my speech -- http://bit.ly/2j9iGfY

I would like to thank Secretary Fanning for awarding me with the U.S. Army Decoration for Distinguished Civilian Service Award.  Click here to read more about the highest civilian award presented by the Army. http://bit.ly/2ittWVQ
Today, we honor the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. #MLKDay
Yesterday, I stopped by WDTN-TV to talk about inauguration and goals for the new Congress.
I would like to congratulate President Trump and Vice President Pence on their #inauguration today. I look forward to working with them in the near future.
Making Dayton the home of the VA archives has been a longstanding goal that I have worked for with our community and I look forward to seeing this honor come to life.  Click to read my statement.
I would like to congratulate my friend, former Congresswoman Heather Wilson on her nomination to become Secretary of the Air Force.  Click below to read my statement.
I have sent a letter to the Chairman of the Board of Trustees for the National Aviation Hall of Fame upon receiving troubling information.  Click below to read my letter and my statement.
I met with University of Dayton President Eric Spina to discuss some of UD's new projects and initiatives. I look forward to working with him in the future.
I am pleased to have the support from two of the National Aviation Hall of Fame Trustees. This support ensures we will not be impeded throughout our investigation.   Click below to read my statement.

The Administration needs to work with Congress to keep America safe and avoid chaotic action that impacts people's lives.  Click below to watch my interview with FOX 45 Dayton on the President's executive order on immigration.

Throughout my ongoing investigation, I have found that due to National Aviation Hall of Fameâ€™s troubling financial situation the NAHF has considered disposing of or selling NAHF artifacts. I am calling on the NAHF and NAHFâ€™s Board to immediately cease and desist.

At least 145 suspected overdose fatalities occurred in Montgomery and its surrounding counties in January alone.   I have joined the Addiction, Treatment and Recovery Caucus to educate and raise awareness among my colleagues in Congress about addiction prevention and substance abuse.  Click below to read more.
As part of my investigation of the National Aviation Hall of Fame, I have asked our community leaders to form a Blue Ribbon Panel.  Click to read my letter.
I would like to thank Senator Rob Portman for his continued support of this investigation of National Aviation Hall of Fame.  Click to read our statements.
Happy 106th birthday to one of our greatest presidents, Ronald Reagan.
I am pleased to receive the support of Chairman of the House Committee on Natural Resources, Rep. Rob Bishop, on the National Aviation Hall of Fame investigation.  Click below to read his letter.

I have reintroduced the TREAT Act to take commonsense steps to expand access to the resources used in treating individuals suffering from substance abuse disorders.  Click to read more about my legislation below.

We have seen way too many overdoses and way too many deaths from the opioid epidemic. I've reintroduced the TREAT Act to help those suffering from addiction.  Click below to read more and watch via WDTN-TV.
I've introduced the TREAT Act to spend federal funding to fight the heroin epidemic.  Click below to watch via WHIO.
I am confident the Blue Ribbon Panel will be able to create a viable future for National Aviation Hall of Fame.   Click below to read my latest letter to Chairman Bill Harris.
I sent a letter to the National Aviation Hall of Fame today questioning the Congressionally Chartered organizationâ€™s breach of contract. Click here to read my letter -- http://bit.ly/2kHFQKc

In response to the President of National Aviation Hall of Fame's comments to Dayton Daily News, I have lost faith in the leadership of the organization. Therefore I am drafting legislation to terminate its Congressional Charter.  Click below to read the latest development in my investigation.

I have had the privilege of working and traveling overseas with John McCain to strengthen our Armed Forces. He has not only been a hero for our country but also a mentor to me. I have no doubt that Senator McCain will tackle this diagnosis with his decided courage and strength. My thoughts and prayers are with the Senator and his family.

I am deeply saddened to hear of the passing of my former colleague, Congressman Ralph Regula. Congressman Regula worked diligently for Ohio, including securing funding for the development of the Victor J. Cassano Health Center in Dayton. It was a privilege to serve with him. My prayers are with his loved ones at this time.

President Donald J. Trump's announcement this evening makes it even more clear that Congress must act as soon as possible to repeal the sequestration of defense in order to appropriately fund our military. Maintaining a budgetary fiction at odds with the realities of the missions our men and women in uniform are asked to perform is irresponsible. The majority of Republicans in Congress want to repeal defense sequestration. Now is the time to do it.
